name: @local/app
author: <akauppi@gmail.com>
--: -- following stuff matters for development, only --

scripts.test: if port-is-taken --silent 3000 ; then cypress run ; else npm run -s _test_1 ; fi
scripts._test_1: concurrently --kill-others --success=first -n dev,cy "npm run -s dev:local" "wait-for 3000 && npm run -s test"
scripts.ci: concurrently --kill-others -n dev,test "npm run -s ci:dev" "wait-for 4000 && cypress run"
scripts.ci:dev: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "npm run --silent _ci_dev_local_emul" "npm run -s _dev_local_init && npm run -s _dev_local_vite"
scripts.dev:local: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "npm run --silent _dev_local_emul" "npm run -s _dev_local_init && npm run -s _dev_local_vite"
scripts._checkNoLinks:
tools/check-no-links.sh || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: 'npm' links not allowed in a production build. Use them only at development.
	Use 'npm list' to see them; 'npm unlink x; npm install' to remove.
"; exit 8)
scripts._checkOnline:
[[ -f .firebase.online.js ]] || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: '.firebase.online.js' file is missing; see 'README.md' on how to create one.
"; exit 7)

prettier: > when Prettier is installed or updated, it’s strongly recommended to specify the exact version in package.json: "2.3.0", not "^2.3.0".

engines: '--experimental-json-modules' seems to be available for Node 12

/not/ firebase: It's important we *don't* list 'firebase' as a peer dependency, though mentally it is. Because:
- we don't want to mention the version twice (only at the root level)
- we'd force 'app-ops-deploy' to pull in *all* of 'firebase' (and it would likely do it locally, which is unnecessary)
Instead, root defines the version and both us and 'app-ops-deploy' pull in the necessary '@firebase' modules, directly.
